explanation:
- MHD_lookup_connection_value: The target directly calls this function to obtain the Accept-Encoding header string (ae). To determine whether any memcmp usage on null-terminated header strings occurs in the overall call chain, the implementation of this function must be inspected.
- MHD_lookup_connection_value_n: MHD_lookup_connection_value calls into this helper; memcmp could be used here to compare header names/values (or partial lengths). The helper’s implementation must be checked for any memcmp usage on null-terminated strings.
- memcmp: The MISRA rule targets use of the Standard Library function memcmp for null-terminated strings. Include this symbol so the next agent can search implementations of the above functions (and their callees) for direct calls to memcmp and confirm whether any such uses operate on null-terminated strings.
